comments:
Build ID: TPTP-4.4.0-200705280100

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Created a new WSDM Project i,e Project1
2.Now started Creating New MRT, When New Manageable End Point Type window comes up, Change File name as "New.mrt" and proceed to create MRT
3.Now Right click on the MRT file i,e New.mrt and Click on Generated DD file menu, so that New.dd file gets generated
4.Right click on the New.dd file Generated the Code 
5.Noticed that resource-instance-0.xml file is created under new_file folder instead of New folder under router-entries section
6.Deploy the Generated code in tomcat and when trying to connect through MAX getting below error

java.lang.Exception: IWAT0758E Cannot connect to WSDM resource because resource does not support Metadata Exchange or resource initialization failed. Please see stack trace for exception thrown by resource.
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.wsdm.internal.muse.MuseRuntime.connect(MuseRuntime.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.wsdm.provisional.agents.WSDMAgent.init(WSDMAgent.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.provisional.ManagedResourceAgent.invokeCustomCommand(ManagedResourceAgent.java:382)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.provisional.helper.ManagedAgentCommandHelper.execute(ManagedAgentCommandHelper.java:648)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.provisional.helper.ManagedAgentCommandHelper.connect(ManagedAgentCommandHelper.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.ui.launch.provisional.common.ManagedAgentDelegate.createAgent(ManagedAgentDelegate.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.trace.ui.provisional.launcher.PrimaryLaunchDelegate.run(PrimaryLaunchDelegate.java:267)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:803)
Caused by: org.apache.muse.ws.addressing.soap.SoapFault: [ID = 'DestinationUnreachable'] There is no resource available at the given EPR: 

<wsa:EndpointReference xmlns:wsa="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">
    <wsa:Address>http://localhost:8080/New3/services/New</wsa:Address>
</wsa:EndpointReference>

The existing EPRs hosted by this endpoint are:
	at org.apache.muse.core.AbstractResourceClient.invoke(AbstractResourceClient.java:298)
	at org.apache.muse.core.AbstractResourceClient.invoke(AbstractResourceClient.java:254)
	at org.apache.muse.ws.metadata.remote.MetadataExchangeClient.getMetadata(MetadataExchangeClient.java:77)
	at org.apache.muse.ws.metadata.remote.MetadataExchangeClient.getWSDL(MetadataExchangeClient.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.wsdm.internal.muse.MetadataHelper.retrieveWSDL(MetadataHelper.java:57)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.wsdm.internal.muse.MetadataHelper.getWSDL(MetadataHelper.java:51)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.monitoring.managedagent.wsdm.internal.muse.MuseRuntime.connect(MuseRuntime.java:75)
	... 7 more



More information:
This problem arises in this scenario only, in other Scenarios it works propertly

Still the problem exists in this scenario only
Build: TPTP-4.4.0-200705310943

Since this problem arises only in a particular scenario, deferring to next release. This will be noted as a limitation of the current release .i.e. the MRT file name and name of the resource type should be the same.
When Generating Mini Project from DD file, Router entries are not created in proper folder.
This looks like it is not a MAX problem but is a WSDM Tooling problem.  Changing to more appropriate component.
